Jeff_Chance:
{{short description|American singer-songwriter}} {{Use mdy dates|date=January 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Jeff Chance | image = | birth_name = Jeffrey Barosh Sr. | birth_date = {{Birth date|1954|12|13}} | death_date = {{Death date and age|2008|12|12|1954|12|13}} | birth_place = [[El Campo, Texas]], United States | death_place = [[El Campo, Texas]], United States | instrument = Vocals, [[fiddle]] | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer | years_active = 1985–1992, 2008 | label = [[Mercury Nashville Records|Mercury Nashville]], [[Curb Records|Curb]], Music Master | past_member_of = [[Chance (band)|Chance]] }} '''Jeffrey Barosh Sr.''' (December 13, 1954 in [[El Campo, Texas]] – December 12, 2008) was an American [[country music]] singer, known professionally as '''Jeff Chance'''. He was initially a member of the five-piece band "Texas Pride" which later became [[Chance (band)|Chance]] recording one album for Mercury Records in 1985. As a solo artist he recorded four albums "Picture on the Wall" 1991 and "Walk Softly on the Bridges" 1992 for [[Mercury Records Nashville]] and "Back Again" 2008 and "Between the Sheets" 2013 for Music Master and charted five country singles in the mid-1980s. The second album included backing vocals from [[Shania Twain]]. ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="width:16em;"| Title ! style="width:18em;"| Album details |- ! scope="row"| ''Picture on the Wall'' | * Release date: 1990 * Label: [[Mercury Nashville Records|Mercury Nashville]] |- ! scope="row"| ''Walk Softly on the Bridges'' | * Release date: August 18, 1992 * Label: Mercury Nashville |- ! scope="row"| ''Back Again'' | * Release date: March 25, 2008 * Label: Music Master |- ! scope="row"| ''Between the Sheets'' | * Release date: June 12, 2013 * Label: Music Master |- |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:16em;"| Single ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
